repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Enable all clang-tidy warnings by default instead of disabling them.
This ensures that we don't miss useful warnings on each clang-tidy
version upgrade. A drawback of this is that it will force us to either
fix or adjust the warnings as soon as possible.

comment_data.body: i would expect we could enable this one
does this have many false positives? if not , does clang-tidy have a way to let us ignore specific cases, then we could enable this?

Two warnings

```
/Users/dundargoc/programs/neovim/src/nvim/main.c:350:3: error: function 'setbuf' has no error detection; 'setvbuf' should be used instead [bugprone-unsafe-functions,-warnings-as-errors]
  350 |   setbuf(stdout, NULL);
      |   ^~~~~~
```

and

```
/Users/dundargoc/programs/neovim/src/nvim/tag.c:1562:7: error: function 'rewind' has no error detection; 'fseek' should be used instead [bugprone-unsafe-functions,-warnings-as-errors]
 1562 |       rewind(st->fp);
      |       ^~~~~~
```
Nah, no way to ignore specific cases that I could find. We'll have to rely on clint for now if we want this I think.

I see. Is it helpful to eliminate as many from here as possible, so that it's easier to review the remaining ones?

Alternatively we could move all the "don't care" cases to the bottom, ideally with a comment explaining that they are covered by uncrustify or whatever.
Alternatively we can disable the setbuf warning and hope that we don't run into false positives too often?
I think that's a great idea, it'll help with the bookkeeping the warnings.
Sure, or maybe we can avoid setbuf / rewind.
OK, @ii14 had a big brain suggestion for this so we can remove the braces lines.

```suggestion
  don't use commas in your "comments" you should be fine,
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,49 +1,77 @@
 WarningsAsErrors: '*'
 Checks: >
-  -*,
+  Enable all warnings by default. This ensures we don't miss new and useful
+  warnings when a new version of clang-tidy is dropped.
 
-  bugprone-*,
-  google-*,
-  misc-*,
-  modernize-*,
-  performance-*,
-  portability-*,
-  readability-*,
+  IMPORTANT
+  clang-tidy doesn't support comments but we can simulate comments by just
+  writing text directly here. These are then interpretet as warnings and will
+  be dropped. As long as you start every sentence with a capital letter and
+  don't use commas in you "comments" you should be fine,

comment_data.body: although the size is formally ignored, `BUFSIZ` is a little misleading, `0` would be better. or just keep `setbuf(stdout, NULL)` as there is nothing wrong with the `setbuf()` form for this usecase.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: build: adjust clang-tidy warning exclusion logic
